SUPPOSEDLY.Definition: according to what most people believe, not necessarily true

PENINSULA.Definition: a long piece of land sticking out into a body of water

WRESTLING.Definition: a sport in which two people fight and try to throw each other to the ground

WARRING.Definition: being at war with each other

PAGAN.Definition: non christian, belonging to older religions

REBIRTH.Definition: a new period of growth of something

REVIVAL.Definition: the process of becoming active again

DISTINCTIVELY.Definition: in a way that is characteristic of someone

RELATIVELY.Definition: in comparison with what it was before

ARISTOCRAT.Definition: belonging to the high class in society

HOST NATION.Definition: the nation in which the olympic games are taking place

REGIME.Definition: a strict system of running a country

ARYAN.Definition: belonging to the white, northern European race of people

SALUTE.Definition: a formal movement or sign to show respect

SUPERIORITY.Definition: the fact that one person is better than others

EMBLEM.Definition: a picture of an object used as a symbol to represent a particular group

HINDSIGHT.Definition: the ability to understand an event after it has happened

REGIMES.Definition: strict systems of running a country

GENOCIDE.Definition: the murder of a large number of people belonging to a race or nation

DRAW THE LINE.Definition: set a limit on what is accepted or not

SYSTEMIC.Definition: acting as a base of a society

PODIUM.Definition: a raised area on which a person stands to receive a prize in a sports competition

FIST.Definition: a hand with the fingers held closely together

POVERTY.Definition: the condition of being extremely poor

BEAD.Definition: small, coloured, round piece, usually of glass

LYNCHINGS.Definition: killed in public without a legal trial

GESTURE.Definition: a movement of parts of the body to express an idea

TAKEN HOSTAGE.Definition: taken as prisoners by an enemy in order to achieve their goals

MASSACRE.Definition: the act of killing a lot of people

TERRORISTS.Definition: people who use fear and violence in order to achieve political aims

SPECIAL FORCES.Definition: military forces used for special and difficult operations

CONSTANT.Definition: something that happens all the time, continuously

APARTHEID.Definition: a political system in which people of different race are separated

SEGREGATION.Definition: keeping a group of people separate from another

INSTITUTIONALISED.Definition: created and practiced as an accepted part of a culture

DISCRIMINATION.Definition: treating a group of people differently because of their race, colour etc.

FACILITIES.Definition: a place where particular activities happen

INDIGENOUS.Definition: the native population of a place

BLATANT.Definition: very obvious and intentional, used for something bad

STATUTORY.Definition: a formally approved and written down law

BAN.Definition: an official exclusion of a group from an organisation

BOYCOTT.Definition: to refuse someone to participate in an organisation

OUTCRY.Definition: a strong expression of anger and disapproval

STANCE.Definition: a publicly expressed way of thinking

CREDIBILITY.Definition: the quality of being convincing and believable

UNSURPRISINGLY.Definition: in a way that was not unexpected

EASTERN BLOC SATELLITE STATES.Definition: a group of neighbouring countries under the control of the USSR

ALLIES.Definition: countries that have agreed officially to support each other

TIT FOR TAT.Definition: an action taken as a response to another

LEG.Definition: a stage or part of a process

DOPING.Definition: giving an athlete drugs in order to make them perform better

BLACK BELT.Definition: the symbol of a very high level in the sport of judo

ASSERT.Definition: cause others to recognise it by displaying confident behaviour

WILLINGNESS.Definition: desire and readiness to do something

TOP-DOWN.Definition: made by a few people in authority and affected a lot of people

PERFORMANCE-ENHANCING.Definition: that helped them perform better at sports

IN THEIR OWN RIGHT.Definition: as a result of their own achievements

PITCH.Definition: an area painted with lines for playing sports

INSEPARABLE.Definition: unable to be separated, closely connected to each other

BANNING.Definition: officially not allowing someone to take part in something

RECURRENCE.Definition: the fact of something happening again and again
